track.name: Algorithms
track.descriptions: The true test of problem solving: when one realizes that time and memory aren't infinite.

primary_contest.description:
Welcome to the 13th edition of HourRank! It's a one-hour rated contest with 3/4 algorithmic challenges. Are you fast and accurate enough to win it? 

The challenges are prepared by Sunny Agarwal (ma5termind), Anton Hulikau (lifting) and Shafaet.
primary_contest.name: HourRank 13

model.name: Longest Palindromic Subsequence
model.php_template:
<?php

$handle = fopen ("php://stdin", "r");
function longestPalindromicSubsequence($s, $k) {
    // Complete this function
}

fscanf($handle, "%i",$q);
for($a0 = 0; $a0 < $q; $a0++){
    fscanf($handle, "%i %i", $n, $k);
    fscanf($handle, "%s",$s);
    $result = longestPalindromicSubsequence($s, $k);
    echo $result . "\n";
}

?>
model.ruby_template:
#!/bin/ruby

def longestPalindromicSubsequence(s, k)
    # Complete this function
end

q = gets.strip.to_i
for a0 in (0..q-1)
    n, k = gets.strip.split(' ')
    n = n.to_i
    k = k.to_i
    s = gets.strip
    result = longestPalindromicSubsequence(s, k)
    puts result
end
model.haskell_template:
import Control.Applicative
import Control.Monad
import System.IO


main :: IO ()
main = do
    q_temp <- getLine
    let q = read q_temp :: Int
    forM_ [1..q] $ \a0  -> do
        n_temp <- getLine
        let n_t = words n_temp
        let n = read $ n_t!!0 :: Int
        let k = read $ n_t!!1 :: Int
        s <- getLine

getMultipleLines :: Int -> IO [String]

getMultipleLines n
    | n <= 0 = return []
    | otherwise = do          
        x <- getLine         
        xs <- getMultipleLines (n-1)    
        let ret = (x:xs)    
        return ret
model.preview: Insert characters in a string so that length longest palindromic subsequence increases by at least K.
model.clojure_template:
(use '[clojure.string :only (split triml)])

(
    let [
      q_t (read-line) 
      q (Integer/parseInt q_t) 
    ]

  (
    loop [a0 q]
    (when (> a0 0)

      (
        let [
          n_temp (read-line) 
          n_t (split n_temp #"\s+") 
          n (Integer/parseInt (n_t 0)) 
          k (Integer/parseInt (n_t 1)) 
        ]
      )

      (
        let [
          s (read-line)  
        ]
      )

    (recur (- a0 1) ) )
  )

)
model.erlang_template:
-module(solution).
-export([main/0]).

main() ->

    { ok, [Q]} = io:fread("", "~d"),
    Q_list = lists:seq(1,Q),
    lists:foreach( fun(Q0) ->
            { ok, [N,K]} = io:fread("", "~d~d"),
            { ok, [S]} = io:fread("", "~s")
    end,Q_list),
    true.

read_array(0,D) -> [];
read_array(N,D) -> 
	{ok, [X]} = io:fread("", D),
	[X | read_array(N-1,D)].

read_2darray(0,M,D) -> [];
read_2darray(N,M,D) ->
	Q=read_array(M,D),
	[Q | read_2darray(N-1,M,D)].
model.lua_template:
function longestPalindromicSubsequence(s, k)
    -- Complete this function

q = io.read("*number", "*l")
a0 = 0
while a0 < q do
    n,k = io.read("*number", "*number", "*l")
    s = io.read()
    a0 = a0 + 1
end
